Git FLow

A relative complex process to use git with multiple teams.

git flow cheat sheet

Update your development branch from another branch (main)

git pull --rebase origin main

Undo changes from from commit X and keep Theme

git reset --soft COMMIT-ID

https://git-scm.com/docs/git-reset#Documentation/git-reset.txt---soft

Undo last commit and keep changes

item.title: Linux
item.description:
Memory Management

A really good talk about Memory Management in Linux “SREcon19 Asia/Pacific - Linux Memory Management at Scale: Under the Hood":

Learned a lot:

  • RSS is only measured because it is easy
  • It is not easy to check if your memory is overalocated. It could also be just used very efficiently
  • cgroupsv1 vs cgroupv2
  • SWAP is good to free up memory which is not backed up by anything on the disk. (anon memory)
  • In defence of swap: common misconceptions
  • Linux ate my ram! Don’t Panic! Your ram is fine!
